boardgame.name: Mississippi Queen
boardgame.description: In this light, fun family game, players race their paddleboats down the Mississippi, picking up passengers along the way. But onboard coal supplies are limited, so each ship's acceleration and maneuvers must be carefully planned. Perhaps most interestingly, the twists and turns of the river are unknown at the start of the game, and are only revealed as ships progress downstream._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Expanded by: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Mississippi Queen: The Black Rose_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Mississippi Queen German first edition including the expansion _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;The Black Rose_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, supporting 2 to 6 players. There are some optical issues: - Box top is dented slightly - Box insert is missing completely - One stove is missing on the brown ship - Some stickers on the ships have gone off (replacement stickers still included) - The sticker containing the starting position for the 6th player has gone off (Starting position for the 6th player can be read in the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;The Black Rose_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; rules - Board tiles from the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;The Black Rose_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; expansion have been marked on the back Of these issues only the last one is gameplay relevant, as you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re seeing if the next tile is from the expansion or the base game. Due to the missing insert, the content of the game will be padded inside the box before shipment.
